title: Seamar
description: To replace outdated mail and phone orders, I built a custom ordering platform that allows Seamar’s clients to place orders online seamlessly. Using Drupal with Commerce 2, I extended the system with custom modules to define order windows, invite users in bulk, and send reminders under specific conditions - streamlining the ordering process for both Seamar and its clients.

title: Bike & Co.
description: As part of a complete rebrand of this bike lease organisation, I built a new conversion-focused site, featuring a cascading colour scheme and two JS-heavy conversion forms. One helps users calculate leasing costs, while the other makes it easy to request a personalised quote—complete with bike-specific accessories. Together, these features streamline the site for engagement and lead generation.

title: Inclusie Kompas
description: Designed to maximise findability, the site contains information about inclusivity in the workplace, grouped into four easily navigable categories via a clear colour-coded structure. I implemented a robust search using the Drupal Search API to help visitors quickly access relevant content.

title: Make Day
description: For the Make Day brand overhaul, I built a scalable content-rich site with a clearly structured front-end and a flexible back-end tailored to the Make Day team's workflow. This was a good opportunity to hone my Sass skills, especially getting those overlapping elements and radial gradients to play nice.

title: Plant a Flag
description: I led the development of my current agency's new website, incorporating bold CSS effects like blurs, blend modes, marquees, and a custom image grid. The site also contains select Bootstrap elements such as the accordion and the offcanvas menu, and is built for use in both Dutch and English.
